jx.jx_en_mean: (of a ruminant animal) further chew partly digested food

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cwidu, cudu, of Germanic origin; related to German Kitt 'cement, putty' and Swedish kåda 'resin'

entry.tran: (牛或羊)咀嚼反刍的食物，倒嚼
entry.def: When animals such as cows or sheep chew the cud, they slowly chew their partly digested food over and over again in their mouth before finally swallowing it.

means.word_mean: 1. food of a ruminant regurgitated to be chewed again
2. a wad of something chewable as tobacco
